TikTok Beautiful

Want to know how a machine learning algorithm evaluates your facial appearance?

Note: the algorithm works best with square images, showing only your face/neck.

Your TikTokBeautiful.com Results

More Details

More information

This page uses the algorithm developed by Liang et al. (2018). Neither it nor the algorithm has any affiliation with TikTok or ByteDance.

The algorithm works best with square headshot images. If you are getting weird results, crop your image to be just a face, and convert to jpg.

Does this really work?

The authors found that its results correlated well with human evaluators (rho = 0.90).

But don't take it too seriously.

Gal Godot, literally the most attractive woman alive according to FHM, scores at the 80th percentile.

Also, Liang et al. trained their algorithm on only white and Asian faces. It probably does substantially worse at predicting the beauty of people of other races. e.g. Beyonc√© is rated around the 70th percentile.

Here are some example images they used:

How similar is this to what TikTok uses?

TikTok's algorithm is proprietary, and we probably will never know exactly what it does.

I can tell you that this framework (ResNeXt-50) is an industry standard, and that the algorithm used here is the best public beauty DNN.

I would guess that TikTok uses a heavily modified version of this - I would particularly expect that they at least used a training set which includes non-white/Asian faces - but who knows.
